channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large laughing gas canister between the green box & telegraph post near 277 Southborough Lane, 4th November
item.description:
I found a large laughing gas canister in the gutter. I have removed it to the location above. Please can it be removed and appropriately disposed of.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 286, Southborough Lane, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped vehicle, 4th November
item.description:
It has at present been left on a free parking bay at the end of Colyer Close. It has not moved for at least 3/4 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Colyer Close, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pavements haven’t been cleaned or cleared, 4th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15A, Page Heath Lane, Bickley, London

item.title: Parking issue, 4th November
item.description:
Residents do not have anywhere to park on Hertford road this has become an ongoing issue despite this issue on top of everything the council has decided to add EV parking restrictions on residents that want to park in bays which limits us residents.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hertford Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: White Cabinet left on pavement, 4th November
item.description:
Someone has just dumped a book cabinet on the pavement. It is an eyesore and is taking up space. It has been there for nearly two weeks now, and there is no signage to suggest anyone has arranged to collect it. Please can you get someone to remove it asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30a, Worlingham Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive sheet of glass left on pavement, 4th November
item.description:
Someone has just dumped a large piece of glass (from a shower) on the pavement. It is an eyesore but also a potential hazard. It wont be long until it is knocked over by an animal, by wind, or by a passer by, and then shatter all over the floor. Needs removing ASAP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Worlingham Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unwanted Car Child Seat Dumped on Pavement, 4th November
item.description:
An unwanted car child seat has been left dumped on the pavement outside 43/45 Waverley Road for several months. I previously reported this under FixMyStreet ref: 8137607 which was reported as 'Fixed' on Wednesday, 15 October 2025. However the seat is still there. .Can the local team please remove it. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Waverley Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned ASDA shopping trollies at end of Petts Wood Road by footbridge, BR5 1LA, 4th November
item.description:
Two abandoned ASDA shopping trollies at the end of Petts Wood Road by the railway footbridge, opposite 217 Petts Wood Road, BR5 1LA (Adams House Dental Practice). Not sure how they got there when the nearest ASDA is in Swanley! Please can they be removed - thank you. If they were from our local Morrisons, I would have returned them myself.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 215-217, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree block street light, 4th November
item.description:
Unsafe. Tree with large spread, branches encroaching street lamp and blocking considerable amount of light emitted. Street and adjacent alleyway are in complete darkness. Visibility in immediate vicinity is very poor, rendering area unsafe for both pedestrians, road users and vulnerable individuals out at dusk or later.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayfield Avenue, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
